alert.note: Alert for Fannin; Lamar (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 09 at 3:33AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Central Fannin and Lamar Counties. * WHEN...Until 700 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas as well as ponding of water on roadways. Small creeks, streams, and rivers are also experiencing rises and swift moving water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms ongoing across Fannin county. The thunderstorms are currently moving into central Lamar County where heavy rain and minor flooding is expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paris, Bonham, Reno, Honey Grove, Whitewright, Blossom, Savoy, Ector, Roxton, Trenton, Dodd City, Ravenna, Crockett Lake, Coffee Mill Lake, Sumner, Lake Gibbons, Lake Crook, Pat Mayse Lake, Camp Maxey and Lake Bonham.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
